∗8.11. Consider the group
M = ⟨x, y, z, t | [x, y] = [y, z] = [z, x] = (x, t) = (y, t) = (z, t) = 1⟩
where [x, y] = x−1y−1xy and (x, t) = x−1t−1x−1txt. The subgroup H = ⟨x, t, y⟩ is isomorphic to the braid group B4, and is normally complemented by N =

(zx−1)M
.
Is N a free group (?) of countably infinite rank (?) on which H acts faithfully by conjugation?
D. L. Johnson
∗As pointed by Y. Antol´ın, the group M is the Artin group of type D4; it is proved in (B. Perron, J. P. Vannier, Math. Ann., 306, no. 2 (1996), 231–246) that N is a free group of rank 3 and H acts on N faithfully by conjugation.
